# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            # The word can fit on the current line
            current_line *= " $word"
        else
            # The word exceeds the line width, add it as a new line
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        end
    end
    
    # Add the remaining words on the last line
    push!(lines, current_line)

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
words = split("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", " ")
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This example defines a `wrap_string` function that takes an array of words and wraps them according to a specified `text_width`. If no width is provided, it defaults to 10 characters.

The example usage splits a sentence into individual words, then passes those words to the `wrap_string` function. The resulting wrapped text is printed to the console.
